-How you doing? -[Bill] Doing well, sir. Thank you.

translation.en: Yourself? Sleep well?
-[Odar] Uh, not so well. -No. No? [Bill chuckles]

translation.en: We are actually really shooting the last scene of season one.
Um, that was always planned.
I like emotional endings of shootings.
It was really a beautiful journey.
[woman] Let's roll the camera, please.
[Odar] And action!
[in French] Let her go!
No!
Hi. My name is Jantje.
I'm the showrunner and head writer, um, of Dark.
Of Dark.
[man] Bo and Jantje, take one.

I'm the showrunner, director, and executive producer of 1899.
translation.ko: '1899'의 쇼러너, 감독 제작 총괄을 맡고 있습니다

translation.en: [Friese] It's about a ship of immigrants going from Europe to America.
translation.ko: 이 드라마는 배를 타고 유럽에서 미국으로 가는 이민자들 이야기죠

translation.en: And on their journey, they encounter something very mysterious.
translation.ko: 이들은 여행 중 매우 기이한 상황을 만나게 됩니다

translation.en: But we can talk spoiler now, no? I guess, yeah. So it's…
translation.ko: 스포일러 해도 되나? 안 되나? 될 것 같네요, 그러니까…

translation.en: The whole show starts as a period drama
slash turning into some kind of a horror show.
But then it turns into a sci-fi show
because what we will reveal is that they are stuck in a simulation.
translation.ko: 등장인물들이 시뮬레이션에 갇혀 있다는 게 밝혀지거든요

translation.en: And what they will have to find out is,
first, who put them in the simulation.
And then, the bigger question, how do they get out of the simulation?
translation.ko: 그리고 더 중요한 문제는 어떻게 시뮬레이션에서 탈출하느냐죠

translation.en: [Friese] Ultimately, it's about our existence.
Why we're here on this planet
and who we are and who created us.
translation.ko: 우리는 누구이며 누가 우리를 창조했는지 다루죠

translation.en: -Very deep, deep, meaningful questions. -It's all good.
[man in German] Everything is connected.
Future,
past,
and present.
[in English] We said to Bo and Jantje, "Your cast in Dark was so amazing."
"Who can come from Dark?"
[man] Even while we were still shooting Dark,
I knew that they were going to do a new series, a big series.
translation.ko: 둘이 새로운 대작 시리즈를 만든다는 걸 알고 있었습니다

translation.en: They really wanted to be surrounded by new talents, by new people.
translation.ko: 그들은 새로운 배우들, 새로운 사람들과 일하기를 원했죠

translation.en: They wanted, you know, just to get new ideas and new impulses.
And I knew that it was going to be an international cast,
translation.ko: 다국적 캐스팅이 될 거란 걸 알고 있었기 때문에

translation.en: so I didn't expect at all to be involved in that.
Eventually I received a call from Bo telling me,
"Listen, you know, we always wanted to… to get
translation.ko: ''다크'와 새로 들어갈 프로젝트나 다른 작업 사이에'

translation.en: some distance between the work on Dark and now the new project and everything."
translation.ko: ''다크'와 새로 들어갈 프로젝트나 다른 작업 사이에' '시간 여유가 있는 사람을 원했는데'

translation.en: "But actually, when we consider it, there's enough distance now."
translation.ko: '생각해 보니까 지금이면 충분히 시간이 있을 것 같네요'

translation.en: "There's a part in that show, the captain."
"And we just think you're most apt to do it."
That was a very happy day for me.
Six hours ago, we received a message, coordinates southwest of our course.
translation.ko: 6시간 전에 메시지를 받았습니다 우리 항로에서 남서쪽 해상의 좌표죠

translation.en: We believe this message comes from the Prometheus.
[Brockmann] The character of the captain,
he was described as being a sort of soulful, world-weary,
translation.ko: 감성이 풍부하고 세상일에 지쳐 있고 산전수전 다 겪은 사람이지만

translation.en: kind of weathered but also very handsome character.
translation.ko: 산전수전 다 겪은 사람이지만 동시에 아주 잘생긴 인물입니다

translation.en: Andreas was someone that sort of fits that brief perfectly.
translation.ko: 안드레아스는 그런 역에 딱 들어맞은 배우였어요

translation.en: I think there's a kind of through line of his character from Dark.
translation.ko: '다크'에서 연기한 인물과 비슷한 부분이 있기도 하고요

translation.en: [Pietschmann] In Dark, I had to understand most of it,
because I was the traveler from the future,
from the past, and from everywhere.
So I knew what was going on and was trying to prevent it.
translation.ko: 어떤 일이 일어날지 알고 그걸 막으려고 합니다

translation.en: Now, I'm more or less the one experiencing those weird happenings
translation.ko: 이번에 맡은 역할도 그런 이상한 일을 경험하는데

translation.en: and not understanding them.
So I'm now on the voyage to understand and to find out together with Maura.
translation.ko: 그래서 모라와 그걸 알아내는 여정을 함께합니다

translation.en: I think the story is like a labyrinth, as Maura's mind
translation.ko: 모라의 머릿속처럼 미로 같은 이야기라고 생각해요

translation.en: and Maura's obsession with neurology
and connections in the brain.
translation.ko: 뇌 속에서 모두 연결돼 있는 이야기죠

translation.en: It probably has been the most challenging character
translation.ko: 지금까지 맡았던 역할 중 가장 어려운 인물이고

translation.en: that I have ever played and will ever play.
I am Maura Franklin.
[Maura] I'm not crazy!
I… I know what I've seen. I'm not crazy!
translation.ko: 내가 분명히 봤어 난 미치지 않았어!

translation.en: [Bevan] Emily's character, Maura,
seemed to be an unconventional hero
from the way that Bo and Jantje described her as a character.
translation.ko: 보와 얀톄가 묘사한 걸 보면 그렇게 보였죠

translation.en: Emily has shown in her huge range of work up until now
translation.ko: 에밀리는 지금까지 매우 다양한 모습을 보여줬습니다

translation.en: that she had all of those facets of being slightly mysterious, unknowable,
translation.ko: 약간 미스터리하고 알 수 없는 느낌을 보여줬고

translation.en: incredibly strong, dynamic.
She nailed her audition.
[woman] Eyk. Eyk Larsen.
Maura Franklin.
You're the captain.
[Beecham] When Maura first meets Eyk,
she sees a certain likeness to herself
and… a vulnerability.
Maura is a woman that is so different from everyone he met before.
translation.ko: 모라는 그가 만났던 어떤 여자와도 다른 여성입니다

translation.en: It's not falling in love at first glance,
but he can sense that this is a woman
that is really different from all the other women around him.
They can feel, without telling, that they have a similar problem.
translation.ko: 둘은 말하지 않아도 서로 비슷한 문제가 있다는 걸 느낍니다

translation.en: Why do you take such an interest in the Prometheus?
Did you know anyone on board?
[Bevan] Normally we would cast actors,
auditioning them in real time in this room.
On 1899, we couldn't do that 'cause we were mid-pandemic,
translation.ko: '1899' 때는 팬데믹 중이라 그게 불가능했기 때문에

translation.en: so we did it on Zoom.
It was an opportunity to reach out at a moment
when the world was really closing down.
[Bevan] Bo and Jantje wanted to have this truly international cast,
translation.ko: 보와 얀톄는 다국적 배우를 캐스팅하고 싶어 했고

translation.en: and they wanted everyone speaking their own language.
We ended up casting out of England, Germany,
translation.ko: 우리가 캐스팅한 배우들의 국적은 잉글랜드, 독일

translation.en: Norway, Iceland, France,
Hong Kong…
Spain, Poland, Portugal…
Did you say Denmark?
[Bevan] That was a truly huge challenge for us,
and I think a really groundbreaking idea from them.
[in Spanish] Ah, waiter.
More.
Don't you think you've had enough?
The problem is you're a fucking bore.
Ángel, lower your voice, please.
"Ángel, lower your voice, please. Calm down."
None of these fuckers understands a word I'm saying. Why should I?
translation.ko: 이 인간들 아무도 못 알아듣는데 왜 그래야 하는데?

translation.en: [in English] 1899 is really a complicated construct
in terms of how to deal with different languages.
translation.ko: 여러 언어를 다뤄야 한다는 점에서 복잡하죠

translation.en: We have a crew from all kinds of different countries,
but our main cast is also from all different countries,
and so are the characters in the show.
[in Cantonese] I am Isabella Wei. My character's name in 1899 is Ling Yi.
translation.ko: 전 이사벨라 웨이고 '1899'에서 맡은 인물의 이름은 링 이입니다 "이사벨라 웨이 / 링 이"

translation.en: [in English] The people on the ship, they think that Ling Yi is a Japanese geisha
translation.ko: 배에 탄 사람들은 링 이가 일본인 게이샤고

translation.en: who is traveling with her servant.
In reality, she is a very poor girl from Hong Kong.
translation.ko: 사실 링 이는 홍콩에서 온 매우 가난한 소녀예요

translation.en: [in Cantonese] What would you need that many knives for?
[woman] I don't know.
Try and pretend you know.
[in English] We'd like to add, "Just eat it."
And so, I think you're picking the knife and the fork.
translation.ko: 그러니까 나이프와 포크를 드는 게 좋겠어요

translation.en: Maybe you share one more look, and then you say, like, "Just eat it."
translation.ko: 한 번 더 보고 '그냥 먹어'라고 말하는 것도 괜찮겠네요

translation.en: -Okay. -Yeah, okay.
-A certain… Do you know…? -[Wei speaking in Cantonese]
-[whispers] That how you say it? -Yeah.
-Okay. -Is that with "just," or is that "eat it"?
There are days where I have to listen to Cantonese the whole day,
translation.ko: 종일 광둥어를 들어야 할 때도 있었는데

translation.en: and I have no clue what they're saying, but I can tell what they're saying
translation.ko: 광둥어는 전혀 모르겠지만 뭐라는지 알 수 있었습니다

translation.en: by rehearsing a lot
and trusting the actors that they tell me,
"This is the angry version of 'I love you' in Cantonese,"
as almost everything in Cantonese sounds, to us, very angry.
translation.ko: 우리에게는 광둥어가 대부분 화난 것처럼 들렸어요

translation.en: [Friese] We had to come up with a lot of systems
for us to understand what everyone is saying.
Um, is this in character? Is this not in character?
translation.ko: 이 대사가 이 인물에게 맞나? 안 맞나?

translation.en: [woman] And let's roll sound.
[in French] You used me to get what you wanted.
[Wei] Cantonese, Spanish, Danish, Polish, German, French.
translation.ko: 광둥어, 스페인어, 덴마크어 폴란드어, 독일어, 프랑스어

translation.en: We all have language assistants with us on set
who kind of help us if we have missed a line or have said something wrong.
translation.ko: 우리가 놓친 대사나 잘못 말한 대사를 고칠 수 있게 도와줬습니다

translation.en: [in Danish] My name is Lucas Lynggaard Tønnesen.
I play Krester in the new Netflix series 1899.
translation.ko: "루카스 륑고르 퇴네센 크레스터" 넷플릭스 시리즈 '1899'에서 크레스터를 맡았습니다

translation.en: [woman in German] Everyone, from the start!
[in English] The first scene we see Krester in,
translation.ko: 크레스터가 처음 등장하는 장면이 제가 가장 걱정했던

translation.en: it was actually one of the scenes I was most worried about.
translation.ko: 크레스터가 처음 등장하는 장면이 제가 가장 걱정했던 장면 중 하나였습니다

translation.en: The dining room is full of these high-profile individuals,
and this guy suddenly appears who looks like a freak,
translation.ko: 갑자기 이렇게 괴물같이 생긴 남자가 나타나

translation.en: asking something on a language they don't understand.
translation.ko: 그들이 못 알아듣는 언어로 무언가를 부탁하죠

translation.en: [in Danish] Excuse me. Excuse me.
Excuse me.
We need help.
[woman] You embrace the fact that you don't understand one another.
translation.ko: 서로의 말을 못 알아듣는다는 걸 알고 있는 상태인데

translation.en: You don't have to spend the scene going, "I don't understand you."
translation.ko: 계속 '당신 말을 몰라' 그런 식으로 있으면 안 되죠

translation.en: It's just in the scene, and you just have to get on with it.
translation.ko: 그 장면에서는 뭔가를 계속하고 있어야 해요

translation.en: Much like you would in real life, if you were found in these situations.
translation.ko: 실제 살면서 그런 상황에 놓였을 때처럼요

translation.en: You just have to just… run with it.
translation.ko: 그냥 그럴 때는 상황에 맡기는 거죠

translation.en: [in Danish] We need a doctor! Let go of me!
[man in English] The weird part, it's speaking your language
to someone that you know is not understanding you.
I have a love interest in the show, Krester,
with whom I communicate a lot… in very special ways.
translation.ko: 저는 아주 특별한 방식으로 많은 소통을 하는데

translation.en: But not with words, just with the eyes,
with the body language.
And I think that makes it very special.
A lot more special than
what it would be if I could just say it.
translation.ko: 훨씬 특별한 방식이라 할 수 있겠죠

translation.en: 'Cause of his eyes, he can tell that
Krester has a similar past as he has.
translation.ko: 그가 자신과 비슷한 과거를 가졌다는 걸 압니다

translation.en: They understand each other very well.
They understand troubles they've gone through
because they're both gay in a time where you can't be gay.
translation.ko: 둘 다 게이고 당시는 게이로 살 수 없는 시대였으니까요

translation.en: [Tønnesen] It's absolutely amazing to have all these nationalities combined.
translation.ko: 많은 나라 사람이 함께 섞여 있는 건 진짜 굉장해요

translation.en: We can communicate in sort of a way.
It really depends on how we see through the language barrier.
translation.ko: 언어 장벽을 어떻게 넘느냐가 정말 중요하죠

translation.en: Ladies and gentlemen…
Ladies and gent… Oh, is it?
-He's trying to…? -Come here.
Ladies and gentlemen, welcome to… [tudum] Word.
translation.ko: 신사 숙녀 여러분 '투둠 단어 맞추기 쇼'입니다

translation.en: What does "bangers and mash" mean?
-Bangers? -Bangers?
"Bangers and mash."
-Sorry. -[repeating in Cantonese]
Oh, God.
There's a lot of people from different countries working.
translation.ko: 여러 나라에서 온 사람들이 일하고 있습니다

translation.en: That's really cool.
I feel like it's "custard."
No, it's not.
I agree.
[in Polish] My name's Maciej Musiał, and I play Olek in 1899.
translation.ko: 전 마치에이 무시아우고 '1899'에서 올레크를 맡았습니다 "마치에이 무시아우 / 올레크"

translation.en: It's fine.
[Musiał in English] Olek finds Ling Yi on the deck
translation.ko: 올레크가 갑판에서 링 이를 발견했을 때

translation.en: when she's trying to hide from her mother.
translation.ko: 링 이는 자기 엄마를 피해 숨어 있었어요

translation.en: And he's like, "Oh, come. I can hide you."
[Olek in Polish] Are you cold?
[in English] It's a beautiful scene 'cause we don't understand each other.
translation.ko: 서로의 말을 못 알아듣기 때문에 아름다운 장면입니다

translation.en: She speaks Cantonese, and I speak Polish.
Just by our intentions, we understand each other.
[in Polish] Dirty. But warm.
[in English] I believe that in languages, you have seeds of cultures,
translation.ko: 언어에는 각 나라 문화의 씨앗이 담겨 있고

translation.en: of feelings, of… of different countries,
and in order to, like, meet them,
you have to be brave enough to listen to them.
translation.ko: 그 언어를 귀 기울여 들을 용기가 있어야 합니다

translation.en: I think this show gives you the opportunity.
It feels like you're… you're traveling to all those places.
translation.ko: 다양한 곳을 여행하는 기분을 느낄 수 있는 기회를 드릴 겁니다

translation.en: [producer] I've got something to send you Josefine sent me from Denmark.
translation.ko: 덴마크에서 조세핀이 보낸 걸 전달하고 싶었어요

translation.en: There's no quarantine there
so it looks like we might be able to go to Denmark…
translation.ko: 덴마크로 갈 수도 있을 것 같은데…

translation.en: [Odar] The first issue we were facing was the pandemic
that happened that, yeah,
turned this world upside down.
We wanted to make a European show
with a European cast and a European crew.
translation.ko: 유럽 출연진과 유럽 스태프를 쓰고 싶었습니다

translation.en: Wanted, actually, also to travel to all these places
where we wanted to shoot and just realized,
"Wait, we can't do that anymore."
[producer] We have to get special dispensation…
Every production is always a headache. It's always a crazy puzzle.
translation.ko: 언제나 모든 제작이 골치를 썩이고 까다로운 퍼즐 맞추기 같아요

translation.en: But in COVID, it's insane.
You're not only dealing with people who are going to be in other shows
translation.ko: 다른 작품에 참여할 사람들 스케줄 문제뿐만 아니라

translation.en: or traveling from countries. They've got families.
translation.ko: 국가 간 이동도 문제예요 다들 가족이 있으니까요

translation.en: You're also dealing with quarantine.
Quarantine when they go home, quarantine when they come to us.
So if someone's coming two days, you're taking them out for three weeks.
translation.ko: 이틀 촬영을 위해 오려면 3주의 시간을 비워야 해요

translation.en: That's when the Volume started to be talked about.
Me and Bo, I think we're both quite strong in stressful situations.
translation.ko: 저와 보는 둘 다 스트레스 상황에 꽤 강한 편입니다

translation.en: There are people who just crumble under stress.
And I think both… Bo and I, we kind of… grow.
[Odar] Someone at Netflix told us about the Volume technology.
translation.ko: 넷플릭스 측의 누군가가 볼륨 기술 얘기를 했습니다

translation.en: At the beginning, we didn't really take it seriously, to be honest,
translation.ko: 처음에는 진지하게 생각하지 않았어요 솔직히 우리는 매우 전통적인 방식으로 만들거든요

translation.en: because we are more the very traditional filmmakers.
translation.ko: 솔직히 우리는 매우 전통적인 방식으로 만들거든요

translation.en: Anything that can be done in camera, we prefer.
translation.ko: 우리는 뭐든 카메라로 직접 찍는 걸 선호하죠

translation.en: Like, we really hate green screen.
Venturing into something that's completely new is very difficult,
translation.ko: 완전히 새로운 무언가에 도전하는 건 무척 힘든 일이고

translation.en: and it helps if the people at the table
understand what each and every one is talking about.
translation.ko: 무슨 이야기를 하는지 알아야 도움이 됩니다

translation.en: Some key figures for us were definitely Udo Kramer and Nik Summerer.
translation.ko: 핵심적인 역할을 해 준 건 우도 크라머, 니크 주머러죠

translation.en: They already know what kind of look we're aiming for,
translation.ko: 둘은 우리가 목표로 하는 게 어떤 건지 알았고

translation.en: and we know that we can communicate with them
and that the communication works.
The Volume is an incredible artistic tool to work with.
But it also is quite a beast in its own rights,
translation.ko: 하지만 동시에 자기주장이 있는 야수이기도 해서

translation.en: and it can be really challenging
to actually tame this Volume animal.
[Odar] Every person who reads about it
or watches some "making of" always thinks it's a magic tool.
translation.ko: 제작 과정 영상을 본 사람은 볼륨을 마법 도구라고 할 겁니다

translation.en: You just push a button, you choose any landscape you want.
translation.ko: 그냥 버튼 하나로 어떤 배경이든 선택할 수 있어요

translation.en: And in seconds you have it, and you can do it right away.
translation.ko: 생각한 걸 즉시 실행시킬 수도 있죠

translation.en: It's a lot of prep work.
It is a lot of frustration.
It is literally a new way of filmmaking.
translation.ko: 말 그대로 영화 제작의 새 방식이에요

translation.en: [Friese] Going into production,
we didn't know whether this was actually going to work.
translation.ko: 이 방식이 정말 성공할지 어떨지 모르고 시작했어요

translation.en: We did a lot of research,
but there wasn't so much research we could do.
translation.ko: 조사할 수 있는 자료가 별로 없었습니다

translation.en: There was just basically one show that used this technology before.
translation.ko: 볼륨 기술을 사용한 작품이 한 편밖에 없었거든요

translation.en: [Odar] We did the test shoot in London.
Really tested things that we knew will not work
translation.ko: 이 기술이 안 되면 왜 안 되는지

translation.en: to understand why it's not working.
Really harsh sunlight scenes are still tricky to create
translation.ko: 태양광 장면을 구현하는 건 여전히 무척 까다롭습니다

translation.en: because the sun is such a hot source
that it's really hard to create on stage.
But the stuff that actually then worked…
And that was, for example, the evening atmosphere.
translation.ko: 예를 들어 저녁 분위기의 배경을 만들어 냈죠

translation.en: We shot with a woman standing there in the desert
translation.ko: 한 여자가 사막에 서 있는 걸 촬영했는데

translation.en: and had this really beautiful reddish sunlight
on her hair and skin tone.
It was really mind-blowing for us that it looked so real.
translation.ko: 진짜 석양처럼 보여서 정말 깜짝 놀랐습니다

translation.en: We've looked at each other, Nik and I.
And we knew, "Okay, this is definitely the way we're going."
translation.ko: 그리고 이 기술을 쓰면 되겠다고 확신했습니다

translation.en: [interviewer] How would you describe the Volume to somebody who knows nothing about it?
translation.ko: 볼륨 기술을 모르는 사람에게 어떻게 설명하시겠습니까?

translation.en: Well, I tried to describe it to my son, and I just said…
"It's like the biggest TV you'll ever see,
translation.ko: 당신이 평생 본 가장 큰 TV 같고

translation.en: and we just act in front of it."
The Volume is a massive, massive cylindrical wall of LED lights.
translation.ko: 볼륨은 아주 거대한 원통형의 LED 벽이에요 "개비 웡 / 육 제"

translation.en: And it literally can take you anywhere in the world.
translation.ko: 우리를 세상 어디로든 데려가 줄 수 있어요

translation.en: [in Cantonese] Mother!
[man in Portuguese] Don't go! Help!
[in English] We call it the Dark Bay.
It's built in the oldest building complex here on the lot.
That's the Marlene-Dietrich stage, built in 1910.
Fritz Lang's Metropolis was shot in there.
They used, on these stages, rear projection.
The Volume itself is the development of that technology.
translation.ko: 볼륨은 후면 영사 기술의 발전된 형태입니다

translation.en: It's rear projection brought into the future.
We have 350 square meter shooting area,
270 degrees of viewing angles.
And has an industry-first revolving stage,
which can basically move the entire set
translation.ko: 세트 전체가 돌아가게 만들 수 있고

translation.en: and enable the filmmaker to shoot 360 degrees
in whatever environment you could think of.
[production designer] We thought we could bring this on a new level
and try to not change the set all over again,
but change part of the set that fits in like a pizza slice.
translation.ko: 피자 조각처럼 세트의 부분 부분을 끼워 넣어 바꿨어요

translation.en: Get this part, bring it in here.
Whoops.
Go back, shoot it.
[Summerer] So now we have a turnaround situation
of just a few minutes.
Actually, we have camera assistants complaining that they have no time to have a cigarette.
translation.ko: 촬영 보조들이 담배 피울 시간이 없다고 불평합니다

translation.en: [woman] Start the rain, please.
[Summerer] The other great thing that we have in here is a rain rig.
translation.ko: 또 하나 훌륭한 점은 강수 설비가 있다는 겁니다

translation.en: And this is something where I think nobody believed in but Bo
translation.ko: 아무도 이게 가능하다고 생각 못 했을 것 같은데

translation.en: that this is possible.
And I'm not talking about drizzle, I'm talking about proper rain,
translation.ko: 물을 뿌리는 게 아니라 진짜 비처럼 내리게 해서

translation.en: where we've been all standing, and the actors have been standing,
translation.ko: 우리도 계속 서서 맞고 배우들도 맞아서

translation.en: and we all got really wet.
And it worked like a breeze.
Nice. Come here, I'll help you.
And this boot.
Yay, here's my flying sweetheart!
It's okay. It's okay. I'm fine. Thank you so much.
It's really hard to kill people.
Hiya. I'm, uh, Fflyn Edwards,
um, and I just did a stunt.
Hey. Nice to meet you, guys.
Introduce yourself.
I'm Antje, the stunt coordinator on this show.
I'm really proud to be here, and he did just an awesome job.
translation.ko: 함께해서 자랑스럽고 방금 얘가 멋진 연기를 했어요

translation.en: I don't wanna do this anymore.
That's why I… I rest.
I already killed him multiple times. You know, the boy. So, um…
translation.ko: 벌써 애를 죽였어요 몇 번이나요, 그 소년요 그래서…

translation.en: Yeah, I think they're doing it up there again.
translation.ko: 네, 저 사람들은 위에서 또 하나 보네요

translation.en: [in Danish] Throw the boy overboard!
[Maura in English] Stop!
Don't do this, please!
[in Danish] Don't let them stop us!
[Erwolter] To be honest, I feel guilty that I start this riot,
translation.ko: 솔직히 죄책감이 드네요 내가 시작한 폭동인데

translation.en: and I'm sick and sitting right here in a robe.
translation.ko: 지겹다고 가운 입고 여기서 쉬고 있잖아요

translation.en: [Rau] Three, two, one, go!
When you do work in a virtual production,
you have to create content beforehand.
You're kind of pulling postproduction up front before shooting.
translation.ko: 촬영 전에 후반 작업을 하는 것과 비슷하죠

translation.en: It was new for everyone on both sides,
on our traditional filmmaker side,
but also on the side of the guys who are actually doing all the backgrounds,
Framestore from London.
[man] We started this when there was no script.
Jantje was writing. The story was evolving.
translation.ko: 얀톄가 집필 중이라 이야기가 만들어지고 있었죠

translation.en: There was just an idea.
With virtual production, we have to provide content,
visual effects, before we film,
so that on the day when we film,
we have content that we can provide and get it in camera.
translation.ko: 우리는 촬영하는 날 콘텐츠를 받고 그걸 카메라에 담아 제공했습니다

translation.en: [in German] It's great, no?
[in English] The basic key for me as a designer is there is no virtual set
and the physical set or different sets.
translation.ko: 가상 세트, 실물 세트 다른 세트가 없단 겁니다

translation.en: There's a set, and the set is following the story.
translation.ko: 모형 세트가 있어요 이야기에 따라 만든 세트죠

translation.en: The Volume itself, it's logistically challenging.
translation.ko: 볼륨으로 작업할 때는 물류 운반이 문제입니다

translation.en: It requires far more prep time.
You need to be close in contact with all your colleagues.
Working with Udo on the production design
translation.ko: 우도와 세트 디자인 작업을 하는 건

translation.en: was a new experience, I think, for some of our artists
because they were used to receiving production designs,
translation.ko: 그들은 세트 디자인을 받은 뒤 그걸 구현하는 작업에

translation.en: and just translating them.
In this case, for 1899, we were developing them from scratch with him.
translation.ko: '1899'의 경우는 아예 처음부터 우도와 함께 작업을 했습니다

translation.en: His sets needed to fit into our environments or our virtual sets,
translation.ko: 우도의 세트는 우리의 작업 환경과 가상 세트에 맞아야 했고

translation.en: and our virtual sets needed to work with his.
translation.ko: 우리의 가상 세트는 그의 작업에 맞아야 했어요

translation.en: It's a lot of fun to do it and see so many people, um, being on it.
translation.ko: 상당히 재밌는 작업이었고 많은 인원이 동원됐습니다

translation.en: Not that feeling, "Ah, I'll fix it in post."
Or, "We do it now, and we see later what's going on."
translation.ko: 일단 먼저 만들고 나중에 보자는 식은 아니었죠

translation.en: It's now or never, and you get the magic to be on the point.
translation.ko: 나중이 없었기 때문에 마법 같은 일이 일어난 겁니다

translation.en: It's stressful, but the payoff is amazing.
Can you see my screen?
[Odar] Yes.
Can you show the LED wall just so I understand where it would be?
translation.ko: 그게 어디 있게 될지 파악하게 LED 벽을 보여 줄 수 있나요?

translation.en: [Summerer] Christian Kästner and the team of Framestore,
they shaped all this in the beginning.
So we had a lot of scoutings
in a virtual world of where we wanna go.
translation.ko: 우리가 가게 될 곳의 가상 세계의 정보요

translation.en: What angles are we shooting? Where could we stand with the camera?
translation.ko: 어떤 앵글로 촬영할지 어디에 서 있게 되는지

translation.en: Where we wanna be?
This one is still the trickiest to sort out.
[Odar] Uh-huh. So where's the shopping center?
It's fun. You're like a little child.
You create worlds, and then you feel like it's not real enough,
translation.ko: 여러 세상을 만들고 그게 부족하다 싶으면

translation.en: and then you add stuff here and add there.
And step by step, you're getting closer,
creating a reality that doesn't feel like it was created, but it actually exists.
translation.ko: 만들어진 것처럼 느껴지지 않고 실존하는 세계처럼 만들었어요

translation.en: [in German] Yes, thanks.
[in English] Could you go back?
I sent a screenshot
of an area I really liked.
Do you see that?
[Kästner] Bo was shooting ocean plates in Scotland,
and the helicopter captured a valley that he really liked.
He told us, "You know when we talked about Scotland?"
"This is what I really would like it to look like."
We decided very quickly,
translation.ko: 우리는 곧 그곳에 가서 주변을 스캔하기로 했습니다

translation.en: "Okay, let's go up and scan the environment."
translation.ko: 우리는 곧 그곳에 가서 주변을 스캔하기로 했습니다 드론으로 그곳의 모습을 스캔하고 사진 측량을 했어요

translation.en: So we did a drone scanning of the environment, photogrammetry.
translation.ko: 드론으로 그곳의 모습을 스캔하고 사진 측량을 했어요

translation.en: After that, we modeled and… and stitched the environment,
translation.ko: 그 후에 그곳의 모습을 그대로 재연해서 만들었죠

translation.en: and that's our background for Scotland.
[woman] Um, already much better.
There's still some kind of strange plants, some stragglers.
translation.ko: 여전히 어색한 식물이나 돌 같은 게 있어요

translation.en: They stand out quite a bit, especially when we rotate to the right.
translation.ko: 너무 튀는데 특히 오른쪽으로 돌 때 두드러져요

translation.en: So that's real rock? Fake rock?
That's us too, right?
[Kästner] Being such a core part of the production,
with 16 people live here
when we're shooting every day, that's super exciting
translation.ko: 우리는 매일 촬영하는 게 정말 신났습니다

translation.en: because for a lot of visual effects artists, this is new.
translation.ko: 왜냐하면 많은 시각 효과 아티스트에게 새로운 일이었거든요

translation.en: It's been, you know, a little bit of a dream come true, I must say,
translation.ko: 약간 꿈이 실현되는 것 같은 기분이었달까요

translation.en: that you can be part of the puzzle.
[in French] Where are we?
How did we get here?
[in English] What is very important for me when it comes to the Volume work
translation.ko: 볼륨으로 작업하면서 정말 중요했던 건 조명 준비였습니다

translation.en: is the pre-lighting,
so that I have time to establish this world,
to create the lighting here,
and that whatever light mood is in the preproduction,
translation.ko: 사전제작 때 어떤 분위기의 조명을 설치할지 생각하고

translation.en: created on the wall, is actually going into the foreground.
translation.ko: LED 벽에서 구현되는 배경에 맞도록 했죠

translation.en: And they, you know, fit well together.
And we're still 1899, so there's no florescent lights or anything,
translation.ko: 1899년에는 아직 형광등 같은 게 없을 때니까

translation.en: so it should be all warmish. It's all fire-based flames, basically.
translation.ko: 전부 따뜻한 느낌의 빛이어야 해요 불에서 나오는 빛 같은 느낌으로요

translation.en: The Hong Kong harbor is my favorite set, I would say.
translation.ko: 홍콩 부둣가는 제가 제일 좋아하는 세트입니다

translation.en: The mood that is created, everything that is on the screens
and the foreground are marrying so nicely together.
It's just such an…
Yeah, beautiful scenery.
[woman] The ambience, the peacefulness of this set,
the way Nik sees the light, how fast he works,
translation.ko: 니크가 빛을 보는 방식이나 그의 빠른 작업 속도나

translation.en: they managed to create something that was so…
translation.ko: 그들이 만들어 내는 걸 보면 너무…

translation.en: I don't know, that was
the most beautiful set I've ever seen in my life.
translation.ko: 제가 평생 본 세트 중 가장 아름다웠어요

translation.en: [man] You don't need to have a part of your brain focused
on projecting and imagining.
You can just receive it.
It looks real. It really looks real.
And it's a huge help for us.
So we don't have to travel to the desert nor to the North Pole nor to the glaciers.
translation.ko: 사막이나 북극에 가거나 빙하를 찾아가지 않아도 됩니다

translation.en: You can change that within a minute.
[Beecham] It would be a different experience on green screen.
translation.ko: 그린 스크린 앞에서 연기하는 것과는 전혀 달라요

translation.en: It just illuminates, like, literally everything.
translation.ko: 그냥 다 보여요 말 그대로 모든 게 보이니까요

translation.en: You can see the whole landscape in front of you and the lighting and…
translation.ko: 앞에 전체 배경이 그대로 보이고 빛도 그대로고…

translation.en: So you're really looking at the sea.
[Craig] It doesn't get less thrilling.
You may stay on a sound stage for 14, 15 hours,
but it still takes your breath away that this is possible.
translation.ko: 이게 가능하다니 여전히 숨 막히게 놀랍죠

translation.en: [Wei] It's so real that a lot of us, when we first stepped onto the Volume,
translation.ko: 너무 진짜 같아서 우리 중 많은 사람이 처음 볼륨 셋트에 섰을 때 뱃멀미를 했어요

translation.en: got seasick when we were watching waves in the background go up and down.
translation.ko: 처음 볼륨 셋트에 섰을 때 뱃멀미를 했어요 배경으로 파도가 치는 걸 보다가 뱃멀미가 났죠

translation.en: I said to Izzy, I was like,
"I just can't believe that we've been able to make a series on here, you know?"
translation.ko: '여기서 드라마 시리즈를 찍을 수 있다는 게 믿기지 않아'

translation.en: "It's just… It's incredible."
She was saying, "I wanna do something on location next,"
and I said, "I absolutely don't. I just wanna stay in here."
translation.ko: 전 절대로 싫다고 여기 계속 있고 싶다고 했죠

translation.en: [Wei] So much has been going into this kimono over so many months.
translation.ko: 이 기모노는 여러 달에 걸쳐 많은 걸 담아 만들었어요

translation.en: All of the designs on this costume have actually Incorporated elements
translation.ko: 이 의상에 담긴 디자인에는 전체 드라마와 관련된

translation.en: from the entire show.
On the bottom of my kimono, we actually have the waves from the ocean.
translation.ko: 제 기모노 밑단에는 바다의 파도가 들어가 있고요

translation.en: And then we have this Japanese landscape, and it's embroidered.
translation.ko: 그리고 일본의 풍경이 자수로 들어가 있어요

translation.en: On my sleeves, there are some mountains,
um, upside down, like the camera flips upside down many times.
translation.ko: 뒤집힌 모양이죠, 드라마에서 카메라가 여러 번 뒤집혀요

translation.en: My favorite detail of this whole thing is actually on the obi.
translation.ko: 제가 제일 좋아하는 디테일은 오비에 담겨 있어요

translation.en: We have a cockroach in the front,
and we have a bunch of little cockroaches in the shape of a triangle,
translation.ko: 한 삼각형 모양 안에 작은 벌레가 여러 마리 있어요

translation.en: which is the earth sign that is shown a lot in the series.
translation.ko: 삼각형 모양은 이 드라마에 많이 등장하는 지구의 상징이죠

translation.en: [Daigeler in German] Are they waiting outside already?
translation.ko: 벌써 밖에서 기다리나요? "비나 다이겔러 / 의상 디자이너"

translation.en: [man] You are all third-class passengers.
You really need to look tired and exhausted.
[Daigeler] Wonderful extras, beautiful, with costume and makeup.
translation.ko: 보조 출연자들 훌륭하네요 의상에 메이크업을 하니 근사해요

translation.en: Could you put on the hat? Thanks.
[Friese in English] It's great to work with people
we've already worked with on Dark,
but I think it's also great to have some new additions in the team.
translation.ko: 팀에 새로운 사람들이 들어온 것도 좋았어요

translation.en: And I'm especially really thankful for Bina
because she's just such a talent and such a hardworking person.
translation.ko: 정말 재능 있고 열심히 일하는 사람이거든요

translation.en: -[in German] Do you like it? -[Daigeler] It's a nice souvenir, no?
[Daigeler in English] All the costumes, they are all done in our workroom.
We made everything.
We made all the shoes, the hats.
There's a lot of embroidery.
We printed a lot of fabrics.
It was all dyed and aged.
So the workroom was huge and a very long process.
translation.ko: 그래서 작업실 규모도 컸고 아주 긴 시간이 들었어요

translation.en: [in German] Do you think it's prettier when you do it this way?
translation.ko: 이렇게 하는 게 더 예쁜 것 같나요?

translation.en: [in English] At the beginning,
all the characters had like four or five changes
translation.ko: 처음에는 각 등장인물에게 의상 네다섯 벌을 준비했어요

translation.en: because of the different dates of the story.
When we discussed the evolution of each character,
we realized that
we rather prefer that each character has one hero piece,
translation.ko: 인물마다 하나의 영웅 의상을 주는 게 좋겠다는 거였어요

translation.en: like a superhero costume.
[Beecham] Basically, our characters don't change.
There's many days, and they are in the same costume.
And that's, of course, a clue to that this is not really as it seems
translation.ko: 그건 그들이 처한 상황이 현실처럼 보이지만

translation.en: and maybe we're not in a reality.
Yeah, Maura is a very modern character for her time.
translation.ko: 네, 모라는 당대 기준으로는 매우 현대적인 인물이에요

translation.en: [Wagner] For Maura, we wanted to have a more simple hairstyle.
translation.ko: 모라한테는 단순한 머리 모양을 만들어 주고 싶었어요

translation.en: In this period, women secretly do blush and lip tint.
translation.ko: 그 시대에는 여자들은 몰래 블러셔나 틴트를 썼는데

translation.en: Maura does not.
She also has very simple, um, hair accessories
translation.ko: 또 머리 액세서리도 단순한 걸로 했습니다

translation.en: as she has just two golden pins
in the hairstyle.
In 1899, all the women still were wearing corsets.
Wouldn't Maura, perhaps, be a person
who, once she is on the boat,
she just forgets about the corset and just said,
"I am without it. I'm done with it."
[Friese] It has been such a joy to see how the characters actually are shaped
translation.ko: 등장인물이 각자의 의상을 입고 점점 실체화되는 모습을 보는 건

translation.en: by the costumes they are wearing.
And it has been for me, as a writer,
really inspiring
to see how costume and makeup
influence also my choices on the characters.
translation.ko: 등장인물을 어떻게 할지 제 선택이 영향을 받기도 하고요

translation.en: [in French] You know what they say?
Men invented dresses and heels so that women can't run away.
translation.ko: 남자들이 드레스와 하이힐을 발명해서 여자들이 도망 못 친대

translation.en: [Klausing] To find that location, to find the look of the story,
translation.ko: 이 드라마의 이야기를 볼 수 있는 장소를 찾는 게

translation.en: was probably the biggest challenge art department had to face.
translation.ko: 미술 담당 부서에는 가장 큰 어려움이었을 겁니다 "배"

translation.en: There's no ship of that era
which is still floating somewhere or in a museum.
translation.ko: 아직 떠 있는 것도 없고 박물관에도 없고요

translation.en: They're all gone.
We're talking about a ship which is 330 meters long
and was made to travel over the North Atlantic.
And to recreate these environments
translation.ko: 그런 배 안의 모습을 재연하는 건

translation.en: is something which takes a lot of energy from a production designer.
translation.ko: 세트 디자이너가 많은 에너지를 쏟아야 하는 일이죠

translation.en: [in German] That's the first pipe, second pipe.
translation.ko: 저게 첫 번째, 두 번째 파이프야

translation.en: [in English] I'm addicted to details.
translation.ko: 전 모든 면에서 자세한 걸 좋아합니다

translation.en: Could be the architecture, the surfaces, the moldings, the props,
the set decoration, the right things at the right place.
translation.ko: 장식까지 맞는 장소에 맞는 걸로 배치합니다

translation.en: [woman] We had a lot of reference materials.
And I think this is a good thing to start,
so that you have a feeling for this period, you have to know the rules.
translation.ko: 그 당시의 감각도 알아야 하고 규칙을 알아야 합니다

translation.en: You have to know what you can do and what you shouldn't do.
translation.ko: 뭘 할 수 있고 뭘 하면 안 되는지 알아야 해요

translation.en: Or if you break the rules, then you should do it on purpose
translation.ko: 원칙을 깨는 거면 분명한 의도가 있어야지

translation.en: and not because you didn't know.
1899, what would they have?
No, you should be sure about that,
and then you see what you can find, and you build it around that.
translation.ko: 그다음 찾을 수 있는 걸 알아내서 만드는 겁니다

translation.en: -[leadman blows whistle] -[worker] We're moving on!
[man] The world is very big, visually.
The sets are incredible.
One especially for me is the engine room,
where there's secret panels,
and we find these incredible, designed futuristic machines,
translation.ko: 그곳의 미래형 기계 디자인은 정말 굉장합니다

translation.en: which are mother brains, to operate the simulation.
And I seem to know where all of them are,
and… and I'm able to manipulate them.
I have a device, which is this wonderful silver thing.
translation.ko: 전 멋져 보이는 은색 장치를 갖고 있죠

translation.en: It's got moving plates on it,
which are different codings
translation.ko: 그 장치의 판이 움직이는데 그걸 컴퓨터 머더보드에 연결해 다른 코딩을 입력합니다

translation.en: so I can plug it into these motherboard computers
translation.ko: 그걸 컴퓨터 머더보드에 연결해 다른 코딩을 입력합니다

translation.en: and manipulate the simulation itself.
Even if we use something like the Volume,
we want to create as much as possible in-camera.
translation.ko: 카메라로 직접 찍는 건 최대한 많이 만들고 싶었죠

translation.en: So everything needs to feel believable
and that you can touch it.
In Dark, we had the time machine, and here, we have a weird object.
We're really fans of gadgets.
[Barnard] The design behind these gadgets are very, like, steampunk-esque
but of a completely different world.
1899, through its design, is creating its own genre almost.
translation.ko: '1899'의 디자인들은 그 자체로 거의 하나의 장르예요

translation.en: [Virginia] What's going on?
[whispers] Follow me.
It's like a living organism.
You don't know what it's doing with you. It's a little bit alien-esque.
translation.ko: 당신한테 무슨 짓을 하는지 모르죠 외계 생명체 같기도 하고요

translation.en: We said from the beginning the ship should be its own character.
translation.ko: 처음부터 배를 하나의 캐릭터처럼 만들어야 한다고 했습니다

translation.en: That you feel it's like a weird monster.
[Kramer] We wanted to see the ship not just as a period ship,
translation.ko: 그냥 당시에 있던 대서양 횡단 증기선 같은

translation.en: steaming across the Atlantic.
It's more like a living structure in itself.
translation.ko: 배 자체가 살아있는 것처럼 보이길 원했어요

translation.en: The anti-Titanic, leading directly into the brain of each character.
translation.ko: 타이태닉과 달리 각 인물의 직접 뇌와 연결된 것처럼 보이게요

translation.en: [Kramer] We can go from one cabin to the next
translation.ko: 한 선실에서 다른 선실로 이동할 때

translation.en: through hidden shafts, ventilation chambers, tubes,
translation.ko: 숨은 통로나 환기 통로 배관을 이용할 수 있습니다

translation.en: places that transport the sensation of,
"My God, there's a door behind the wall" feeling.
"I want to see behind the wall."
You feel that you get deeper and deeper into something that you should stay out.
translation.ko: 가까이 가면 안 되는 곳에 더 깊이 파고 들어가는 느낌요

translation.en: I like this kind of tension.
Look at this.
Then I disappear.
1899 was recorded all over the world.
The Tangram Ensemble from London.
Sinfonietta Cracovia,
this amazing string section, the same people I worked with on Dark.
And then there's actually quite a lot of vocal material.
They are the three main elements.
And there's everything that I'm sort of doing with that.
translation.ko: 물론 모든 요소를 제가 작업하고 정리했습니다

translation.en: I took a lot of that material with me
here back to Iceland and took it into
various ships down here in the harbor.
translation.ko: 항구에 있는 여러 척의 배에 들어가 녹음했죠

translation.en: So I'm taking those recordings and actually feeding them through a speaker, um,
translation.ko: 녹음된 음원을 갖고 배 이곳저곳에 들어가서

translation.en: into various parts of the ship,
and sort of using the music to resonate…
literally resonate the hull of the boat.
translation.ko: 진짜 배의 선체에서 울리는 효과를 내려고요

translation.en: Kinda terrifying, honestly.
It… It becomes something else.
It becomes very, um, alive.
[Henry] Our brain is a very complicated construct.
As much as we can try to forget the things we don't want to remember,
translation.ko: 기억하기 싫은 것을 잊으려고 하면 할수록

translation.en: we will never be able to delete them entirely.
translation.ko: 그 기억은 절대 지울 수가 없어

translation.en: They're part of who we are.
Woven into our very fabric.
[man] And landscape!
[Henry] There's no reason to be afraid.
This isn't real.
Remember?
It's so complex that I couldn't say, "Well, it's about this."
translation.ko: 너무 복잡한 이야기라 간단하게 말할 수가 없네요

translation.en: [laughs] It's about so many things.
And, um, I guess if you ask me what it's about
translation.ko: 제게 이 드라마가 어떤 이야기인지 물어보고

translation.en: and you ask someone else, and you get different answers,
translation.ko: 다른 사람한테 물어보면 다른 대답을 할 텐데

translation.en: in a way, they're both true.
I guess I think 1899… Yes, it's incredibly confusing.
And, um, all of these…
No, I don't wanna say that. Um, okay. [chuckles]
Should not say it's incredibly confusing.
translation.ko: 굉장히 혼란스럽다고 말한 건 실수 같네요

translation.en: My picture of it is like a round puzzle that is moving at great speed,
translation.ko: 제가 보기에는 움직이는 둥근 퍼즐 같아요 그것도 빠른 속도로요 얀톄가 퍼즐 조각을 맞추죠

translation.en: and Jantje's putting in the pieces.
translation.ko: 그것도 빠른 속도로요 얀톄가 퍼즐 조각을 맞추죠

translation.en: I have no idea.
I mean, I have no idea how she keeps it all straight.
I mean, I don't know how they do it.
[Friese] The only thing that I think that's really important with mystery
translation.ko: 미스터리를 집필할 때 한 가지 중요하게 생각하는 건

translation.en: is that you don't listen to anyone who says, "I didn't understand this,"
translation.ko: 남의 이런 말을 안 듣는 거예요 '난 이게 이해가 안 갔어'

translation.en: or, "I think this needs to be made clearer,"
translation.ko: '이 부분은 더 명확해야 할 것 같아'

translation.en: or anything like that.
I just go, "La, la."
I gave up to try and understand her brain a long time ago.
translation.ko: 얀톄의 머리를 이해하는 건 오래전에 포기했습니다

translation.en: She puts different, strange worlds together into one,
translation.ko: 그녀는 서로 다른 이상한 세계들을 하나로 만들어요

translation.en: and you think there's no way
they can ever connect, they can ever be combined.
But then later on, it reveals that the one is actually the source of the other one.
translation.ko: 나중에 보면 어떤 세계가 다른 세계의 근원이죠

translation.en: [Friese] I'm a huge puzzle freak.
I love mysteries, and I love, um, solving any kind of riddles.
translation.ko: 미스터리를 좋아하고 수수께끼를 푸는 걸 좋아하죠

translation.en: For me now to be like the person who actually builds the riddle is just pure pleasure.
translation.ko: 지금 저는 수수께끼를 만드는 사람이 됐고 그게 정말 기쁩니다

translation.en: So I'm actually, yes, I'm doing it for the fans,
translation.ko: 네, 사실 맞아요 팬들을 위해서이기도 하지만

translation.en: but I'm also doing it for myself.
translation.ko: 저 자신을 위해 하는 일이기도 해요

translation.en: [Barnard] Jantje is doing all the writing.
Uh, the rest of us are on set with Bo directing.
translation.ko: 나머지 우리는 세트장에서 보의 감독을 받죠

translation.en: As things are being dripped back to Jantje within the edit room,
she can really see what's working, what isn't working,
translation.ko: 그녀는 어떤 건 되고 어떤 건 안 되는지

translation.en: how things could be more interesting.
They have this flexibility to move the story
translation.ko: 그들은 융통성 있게 자기들이 원하는 방향으로

translation.en: in any direction they want.
[Friese] I might see a prop in the background that art department put there.
translation.ko: 미술팀이 배경으로 갖다 놓은 소품을 보기도 해요

translation.en: For example, in Ramiro and Ángel's cabin,
there is an old picture of a wolf and a lamb on the wall,
translation.ko: 늑대와 양을 그린 오래된 그림이 있는데 그걸 보고 영감을 받아 대사를 쓰기도 했어요

translation.en: and that inspired me to actually write a dialogue
translation.ko: 그걸 보고 영감을 받아 대사를 쓰기도 했어요

translation.en: that kind of grasps those two characters.
translation.ko: 두 인물을 파악할 수 있는 대사죠

translation.en: [in Spanish] Why don't you have a little conversation with God?
Ask him why he turned you into a sheep
and me into a wolf.
The power of… of decisions here in the show
translation.ko: 이 드라마 작업에서는 결정권이 집중돼 있어요

translation.en: are very centralized in them, in Bo and Jantje,
translation.ko: 이 드라마 작업에서는 결정권이 집중돼 있어요 보와 얀톄에게 집중돼 있는데 그게 아주 좋아요

translation.en: and I think that's really good.
translation.ko: 보와 얀톄에게 집중돼 있는데 그게 아주 좋아요

translation.en: It adds a lot of personality, their personality.
translation.ko: 많은 개성이 들어가죠 두 사람의 개성요

translation.en: [man] It's still the mind of Bo and Jantje.
They didn't step away from what they want and what they like.
translation.ko: 자기들이 원하고 좋아하는 것에서 벗어나지 않았어요

translation.en: They like weirdness.
They like fantasies.
They like mystery.
They like fucking with your mind.
And that's what they do. Even with us sometimes, actors.
translation.ko: 그리고 어떨 때는 우리 배우한테도 그래요

translation.en: We were like, "We wanna ask about season two for our characters."
They were like, "No! You do season one, and then you'll see."
translation.ko: 안 된다고 1시즌이 끝나면 알게 된다고 말하죠

translation.en: [Barnard] When you go into a scene,
and you've got 100 questions for Bo,
and he goes, "I haven't made that choice yet."
translation.ko: 그는 아직 결정 안 했다고 해요

translation.en: "I don't know if I want this character to go down that road or that one yet."
translation.ko: '이 인물을 계속 그 방향으로 끌고 갈지 어떨지 모르겠어요'

translation.en: "So let's see where we take it where you don't know."
"Yeah, okay, great."
"That's really helpful."
But, you know, that's the… that is the interesting thing about it.
translation.ko: 하지만 그런 부분이… 이 드라마를 흥미롭게 합니다

translation.en: In that moment, you have to make a natural choice of the circumstances…
translation.ko: 그 순간에는 그 상황에 따라 자연스러운 선택을 하고

translation.en: [Barnard] …and play that and play the honesty of the moment,
translation.ko: 그 순간에 정직한 연기를 하게 됩니다

translation.en: regardless of where it's going next.
Maura, please.
[Maura] Get in there.
[Henry] I know all of this
must be quite confusing for you.
[Lesser] You feel a safety in the hands of people who have this pedigree.
translation.ko: 이런 경력을 가진 사람들과 일하면 안정감이 있습니다

translation.en: They've done this amazing series before.
And yet you feel they are operating in a very free way.
translation.ko: 그들이 자유롭게 작업하는 걸 느끼게 됩니다

translation.en: And the way it starts out may be the way it continues or it may not.
translation.ko: 이야기가 시작했던 방향으로 계속 흘러가기도 하고 아니기도 하고요

translation.en: I've not come across that a lot in modern drama.
translation.ko: 현대 드라마에서는 그런 방식을 못 본 것 같아요

translation.en: The key.
[porter] Everyone, please assemble in the dining room.
The captain would like to address the current situation.
What's happening?
They're not telling us a thing.
translation.ko: 제게는 아무 얘기도 안 해 주네요

translation.en: That's what you get when you have a German running this.
translation.ko: 원래 독일인이 있으면 이런 난리가 난다니까요

translation.en: I don't know if it's similar because I've never been a captain on a ship, um,
translation.ko: 비슷한 건지 모르겠지만 전 배의 선장이 돼 본 적이 없어요

translation.en: but I guess it's maybe as exhausting.
[Odar] If you wanna have family on the set,
then you also have to create a safe place for everyone,
and especially for the actors because you ask so much from them
translation.ko: 특히 배우가 안전해야 해요 배우에게는 카메라 앞에서

translation.en: to do in front of a camera, almost being naked.
translation.ko: 거의 벗고 있으라는 것처럼 많은 걸 요구하니까요

translation.en: He's a very dark soul. [chuckles]
Which is very cool.
He's not afraid of the ugliness or…
the deep dark secrets
or sorrow or grief
or… just all the dark sides that humans have.
translation.ko: 인간이 가진 어두운 면을 두려워하지 않아요

translation.en: And I just love to have a director who wanna go in there.
translation.ko: 전 그런 면을 파헤치고 싶어 하는 감독을 좋아합니다

translation.en: [Barnard] I'm not good if I don't trust the director.
translation.ko: 전 감독을 신뢰하지 않으면 좋은 연기를 못 합니다

translation.en: And if a director doesn't make me feel like I can go to places
translation.ko: 그리고 감독이 제게 굉장히 불안정한 상황에 처할 수 있다고 느끼게 하면

translation.en: which are very vulnerable,
translation.ko: 굉장히 불안정한 상황에 처할 수 있다고 느끼게 하면

translation.en: I can't give you my all.
I feel comfortable enough to explore what the possibilities are because of Bo.
translation.ko: 어떤 가능성이 있는지 안심하고 탐험할 수 있는 건 보 때문이에요

translation.en: And that's a good captain, to make you feel safe
in a very vulnerable place.
Him and Jantje, they both know what they want.
translation.ko: 보와 얀톄는 자기들이 원하는 걸 분명히 알아요

translation.en: Sometimes they don't know how they wanna get there.
translation.ko: 그걸 어떻게 성공시킬지 모를 때도 있지만

translation.en: Then you're a part of that creative team, so you help them get there.
translation.ko: 창의적인 팀이 있기 때문에 그들의 도움을 받아 성공시키죠

translation.en: And there's a great essence of family because of that.
translation.ko: 그리고 그런 점이 훌륭한 가족의 본질입니다

translation.en: It's been such a journey. I get so emotional.
People here are amazing.
I met actors from all over the world with different cultures.
translation.ko: 전 세계, 여러 문화권에서 온 배우들을 만났습니다

translation.en: I hope that people see that no matter where you're from,
no matter your skin tone, no matter your religion,
we're just equal, we're just all just human beings.
translation.ko: 모두 평등하고 똑같은 인간이란 걸 알아주길 바랍니다

translation.en: It is the same hurt, love, and happiness.
We're on the same boat.
You're looking for what you have in common and you try to build up a synergy
translation.ko: 서로의 공통점을 찾고 시너지를 내려고 노력해서

translation.en: to create together, and that's what we're doing here internationally.
translation.ko: 함께 만들어 가는 것, 우리는 여기서 그런 일을 하고 있습니다

translation.en: Especially during our time, with COVID and Brexit,
and everyone wants to become way more selfish
than they probably already were.
It's just great just to see that we're all together.
translation.ko: 우리가 함께 노력하는 걸 보는 게 너무 좋아요

translation.en: And this is the beautiful story about 1899.
If you actually wanna survive, we have to be together.
translation.ko: 살아남고 싶다면 모두 함께 힘을 합쳐야 해요

translation.en: No one can survive on their own.
[Odar] I will definitely fall into a hole
after the end of this shoot.
translation.ko: 분명히 텅 빈 것처럼 우울할 겁니다

translation.en: You always do.
'Cause I really…
No one sees me behind my monitors in my tent,
translation.ko: 아무도 모니터 뒤에서 내가 어떤지 모르는데

translation.en: but I do, uh, live the characters as well.
And I do act in front of the monitors. No one sees that.
translation.ko: 아무도 못 보지만 모니터 앞에서 연기도 하죠

translation.en: Just to try to understand what that character could do or not.
translation.ko: 등장인물들이 뭘 하고 안 할지 이해하기 위해서예요

translation.en: Of course, in a very bad way because I'm not a good actor.
translation.ko: 물론 연기는 형편없죠 뛰어난 배우가 아니라서요

translation.en: But, like, I really live these characters,
and it's sad always to say goodbye to them.
